edu.stanford.nlp.mt.train

Class IBMModel1InformedWordAligner

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.stanford.nlp.mt.train.IBMModel1InformedWordAligner
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    WordAligner

    public class IBMModel1InformedWordAligner
extends Object
implements WordAligner
    This class makes use of the GIZA++ style alignment information in SymmetricalWordAlignment to limit the possible English word alignment choice, and then use IBM Model1 score to pick the best one Notice it's not an "IBMModel1Aligner", because it first constrains the possibilities to only the indices provided in the SymmetricalWordAlignment information
    Author:
    Pi-Chuan Chang

    • Method Detail

      • getAlignedEnglishIndex

        public int getAlignedEnglishIndex(WordAlignment sp,
                         int foreignIdx)
        Specified by:
        getAlignedEnglishIndex in interface WordAligner
        Parameters:
        sp - Contains information of the foreign sentence, the English sentence, and the GIZA++ style alignment
        foreignIdx - the index of the foreign word that we want a specific alignment to
        Returns:
        the index of the particular English word this foreign word (with index foreignIdx) is aligned to. If return -1, no good word alignment is produced
